description.narrative: -Improve access, quality, and affordability of healthcare: Through its investments, the Fund will target improvement in access, quality and affordability of healthcare for low-income and middle-income populations in Africa, South Asia, South East Asia and Latin America - Support innovation: The Fund will allocate part of its commitments to greenfield and scalable new businesses in healthcare. The Fund will professionalize emerging healthcare companies and provide strategic and operational value-addition to improve competitiveness. - Demonstration effect: Through the Fund, the viability of investing in pro-low-income/middle-income healthcare businesses would be demonstrated.

Founded in 2002, The Abraaj Group is a global private equity investor operating in the growth markets of Asia, Africa, Latin America, the Middle East and Turkey. Employing over 300 people including more than 170 investment and operating professionals, the Group has over 25 offices spread across five regional hubs in Dubai, Istanbul, Mexico City, Nairobi and Singapore. The Abraaj Growth Markets Health Fund L.P. (AGHF or the Fund) is a single sector private equity fund dedicated to investments in the healthcare sector in various countries in Africa and South Asia. The target Fund size is US$1 billion. The Fund aims to undertake acquisitions, brownfield and greenfield projects to establish sustainable, affordable and high quality healthcare eco-systems in key urban areas. AGHF will make investments in companies focused on the provision of healthcare services, the distribution of medical technologies and medicines, retail pharmacy and other associated healthcare opportunities. The Fund is registered in the Cayman Islands as an exempted limited partnership.
